snippet: Sergey V. Lavrov, the Russian foreign minister who pushed for the Syria chemical arms pact, has spent a career trying to keep the United States in check.
abstract: Sergey V Lavrov, Russian foreign minister who pushed for the Syria chemical arms pact, has spent a career trying to keep the United States in check; arms pact in many ways represents the apex of a career largely spent trying to curb what the Kremlin has long viewed as dangerous unilateralism.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn reported from Moscow, and Michael R. Gordon from Geneva. William J. Broad contributed reporting from New York, and Steven Lee Myers from Valdai, Russia.

lead_paragraph: Sergey V. Lavrov, the Russian foreign minister who pushed for the Syria chemical arms pact, has spent a career trying to keep the United States in check.

headline.main: Veteran Diplomat Fond of Cigars, Whiskey and Outfoxing U.S.
headline.print_headline: Behind Arms Deal, Veteran Diplomat Fond of Cigars, Whiskey and Outfoxing U.S.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
